thread.title: Sudan: Herders Threaten Farmers, Livestock Destroys Crops in North Darfur
thread.title_full: Sudan: Herders Threaten Farmers, Livestock Destroys Crops in North Darfur

title: Sudan: Herders Threaten Farmers, Livestock Destroys Crops in North Darfur
text:
Sudan: Car Owner Slain, Two Passengers Injured in Central Darfur Ambush 
He explained that the land was originally owned by the farmers. "But the herders, armed by the government, forcibly evicted us." 
The farmer called upon the North Darfur authorities to protect them, and enable them to cultivate their land. 
Huge losses 
Farmers in the area of Naro, Abu Shouk, and Rotaba, in the western part of Kutum, lost much of their crops, when herders released their camels and cattle on farmlands, orchards and vegetable gardens last week. 
"Large quantities of melons, tomatoes, radishes, okra, cress, and onions, as well as mangos, oranges, lemons, and grapefruit were destroyed," he said. "The losses are estimated at tens of thousands of pounds. He appealed to the North Darfur authorities to protect their lands from further herders' attacks. Sudan
